oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conducting polymer based electrochemical sensor for strontium in nitric acid medium
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAGINI, PV
RIZVI, GH
CONTRACTOR, AQ
MANCHANDA, VK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: recognition
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A polyaniline/polycarbonate membrane impregnated with a receptor molecule di-tert-butylcyclohexano-18C6 (DtBuCH18C6) was employed as an electrochemical sensor for Sr-II ion in nitric acid medium. Behavior of the molecular device was studied as a function of variables like oxidation potential, crown ether concentration and nitric acid concentration. The sensor response was linear in the limited SO concentration range of 1 x 10(-10) to 1 x 10(-9) M, beyond which a saturation effect was observed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE INDIAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY, 79(12), 949-952
